intro: Lippia gracilis, commonly known as Mexican mint or wild mint, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Lippia gracilis is known for its strong, mint-like fragrance and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies. It is also valued as a ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of cultivation.
